name: Geo-Bullet
tagline: Simulation of granular media by Bullet physics engine with Geotechnical engineering perspective.
body:
### Bullet physics engine
Bullet is a physics engine initially developed for video games and animations purposes. However, it is written based on physical laws. It is fast,robust and handy. To gain more information on Bullet, readers can view [Bullet](https://github.com/bulletphysics/bullet3) on GitHub.
Bullet consists of three major modules:
* Rigid body module: which is based on [contact dynamics](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0167663609000386) approach.
* Soft body module: which is based on spring-mass systems (application of FEM is also feasible).
* Fluid module: using smoothed particle hydrodynamics (SPH)- coupling is in progress...

Besides, Bullet comes with very nice features, such as Voronoi fracturing, CAD file importers, etc.

### Simulation of granular media using Bullet
Since Bullet uses contact dynamics as rigid body solver, soil granules can be modelled as discrete objects with a wide range of geometries. In addition, in the cases in which deformable bodies such as reinforcements, membranes, etc. are associated in the simulation, they can be modelled as softbodies.

### Usage
In order to use GeoBullet, Bullet must be installed already (preferably in ~/Bullet/bullet3/) folder. Moreover, 'Makefile', 'python' and 'Matplotlib' are recommended to be installed.
Every folder in the code repository represent an example, and the codes are written in a way to be self-explanatory, so, with less effort it can be understood.
The file 'variables.h' in each folder represents the main variables and the associated magnitudes for the simulations.
For visualisation purposes, several writers are provided. The output of the writers are recommended to be opened by paraview software.

### Support or Contact
Currently, GeoBullet is maintained by [Ehsan Izadi](https://github.com/Ehsanizadi), but cooperation from other researchers are gladly welcomed. In the case of encountering any problems and difficulties, please ask your questions on [GeoBullet forums on GitHub](https://github.com/Ehsanizadi/Geo-Bullet/issues).
